This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest floors or on rocky surfaces. Its structure consists of a thallus that lacks true roots, stems, and leaves, and instead has specialized structures for absorption. Sarcopodium wichersii is a slow-growing plant that plays a role in soil stabilization and nutrient cycling in its habitat.
